Description: Limestone shabti of Wryy with a striated lappet-wig, a carved face, a collar, crossed hands in low relief holding the two incised hoes, the legs are inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in four rows of incised Hieroglyphs at the front and a central column running down the back, the back is decorated with an incised representation of a seed-basket.
